intro: Amoria hybrida subsp. elegans, commonly known as the elegant amoria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and aromatic foliage.
